reviewText: This movie doesn't try to be one of those horror movies where they try to be as gory as possible. It is a great movie that will chill you to the bones. If you have never seen this movie and are a horror fan, you need to buy this now.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: Great movie and didnt want it to end.  Distrubing but entertaining looking forward to the movie this was a remake to.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: THE RING is, of course, the excellent American remake of the classic Japanese original, RINGU. Both are creepy and suspenseful, w/ THE RING using more of a supernatural-thriller approach. Nonetheless, director Gore Verbinski instills his version w/ a wonderful atmosphere of dread and doom that is palpable. Naomi Watts (MULHOLLAND DRIVE, EASTERN PROMISES, FUNNY GAMES) plays her role as protective mother / unwitting paranormal investigator / desperate victim in her usual, realistic manner. We get the feeling that she truly does have only seven days to live! THE RING is the perfect film for anyone who loves ghost stories, horror movies, or anything disturbing or unsettling. Highly recommended...
Title: The Ring

reviewText: I just reviewed "The Ring 2," so I figured that I should review the first in the series, even though it's been awhile since I've seen it.  I have watched it at least twice though, so most of the scenes are still in my mind.But what I remember most is one of the themes of the film.  It's more of a question really than a theme, but that question would be:  "Would you be willing to throw someone else under the bus to keep yourself from being run over?"  You probably know about the videotape in this film, and how watching that videotape will. . . . O.K.  I don't want to give out a spoiler.  Let's just say that you might want to throw out -- or donate, minus one particular tape -- that old videotape collection.  After all, there's DVD nowadays.  Better yet, how about Blu-ray?  1080P is always nice.  Perhaps better still, maybe HD streaming on a Roku box.  The new 4K technology best still, if it ever costs less than a brand new car.This is one of the issues of this film, really, in the sense that it has already become somewhat dated even though it released about 10 years ago.  Who watches VHS anymore?  No one that I know, and I don't even believe that studios release films nowadays on VHS tape.  But from what I understand, there is a "Ring 3" in the works, which might be problematic since, in my review for "Ring 2," I said that they went to the well one too many times.  Bad joke perhaps, but hopefully the next film, if there is one, will be as good as the first.But I do believe that this is a top-notch horror movie.  It has all the elements that you're looking for:  sympathetic characters, intrigue, scares, etc.  And for me, I guess that it was filmed in the Seattle area, even parts of Monroe, WA, a town that I lived in for about 13 years.  (I believe that the house in one of the opening scenes was a house in Monroe that was up for sale, but I'm not positive.)  So I will admit that this film was more interesting for me than it might be for you due to the area in which it was filmed.A pretty big recommendation by me if you want a good fright.  Maybe watch "The Ring 2" after that, but if you do, watch them in order as I believe the second film requires you to see the first one first.  I don't think that 2 is as disappointing as most of the reviews, so it's worth a peek.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: The movie is good from the beginning. Definitely interesting story line, and intense horror scenes. Leaves you wanting more and that's where the Ring 2 comes in.

reviewText: God this movie scared me so bad when I was in highschool.  I recently showed it to my wife who thought it wasn't that scary, but I still think its really scary. Anyways its pg-13 and more scary than most R rated movies I've seen.....p.s. don't watch the sequel

reviewText: This has been a favorite of mine since it came out at the movie theater.  I just never get's old.  If you enjoy a mind scare...
Title: The Ring

reviewText: Too much of horror these days is redone. A new take in the genre is hard to come by. The Ring is an truly innovative approach to horror and a nicely done piece. Some movies stay with you, and in horror, in the dark, alone, at night .... that's a good thing.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: This is something frightening with class. Superb acting and pacing. Very conservative on the use of blood and gore. Gets into your head and keeps you engaged from scene to scene. This one won't get old.
summary: An Intelligent thriller . keeps you on the edge.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: (Spoilers included)This story is too long and the dialogue is flat.The ending is also wrong. The overdoing of effects to make you think this is scary isn't scary.A truly scary film doesn't need  all of that.However it does have a good plot and goodactors to compensate for some of its major failures. This is only why I'll give it 2 stars.A horror film is suppose to jump out at you. I wasn't shocked or surprised by anything. Also, the main characters (protagonist)becoming evil. The mother and son really?No ending on a positive note.
summary: Don't understand why ppl like this film...
Title: The Ring

reviewText: Though I like the Japanese version better as I tend to of these remake movies, the end of this was just classic and chilling.I won't give it away as I am not one for spoilers, but if you have not seen the Japanese version, give it a go as well.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: This movie was a real heart stopper. I loved Naomi Watts in this and she and the boy who plays her son did an excellent job. The story line is believable from the beginning and some of the scense had me on the edge of my seat. Anyone who likes mystery, intrigue and some horror will love this movie. Worth watching more than once.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: I have yet to see the Japanese version of the Ring, so obviously, unlike other websites, I cannot comment onto whether or not the American version is superior or inferior. What I can say is that this was one hell of a movie, and in a way I'm pleased to be able to review it on it's own merit without the influences of another flick in my mind.I went into it with mixed emotions. All have heard the hype of how terrifying or disturbing it is. Since I very very rarely become frightened by the cinema, I tried to rely more on the plot for my expectations. The story itself sounded...weak. A video tape that kills you after seven days??? I didn't see how it could be pulled off.Thankfully I didn't go in expecting the best from all the hype, but in a way the worst, and I turned out very suprised in a positive way.First of all - the story. Wow. Creative as hell, a real mind-twister - Gotta love mysteries. You just had to watch to the end once the movie itself pulled you in - much like what Samara does to her victims. ;) We begin with two teenage girls in a slightly modern, cliche manner and then are cut off to an episode that is supposed to be construed as frightening (for them, not me). We then jump to the character of Rachel, played by the very talented and appealing Naomi Watts, a reported and mother who was an aunt to one of the girls.Her son was negatively affected by his cousins' death and is in many ways more than a simple little boy. He plays the part well - solemn, slightly off the rocker, and perhaps a little psychic. Rachel soon decides the death of her niece is worth a thorough investigation and ventures out into the rest of the tale with a mixture of optismism, skepticism and personal horrors all her own. Her sidekick ex-husband Martin, played by Noah Keller, is very likeable and makes his scenes enjoyable.Truly some surprises along the way, not predictable at all - an intelligent film that doesn't need gore and excess violence to accomplish what it sets out to do.Samara herself is one creepy chick. Throughout the movie you don't really know what to think of her.The end has a shock of its own in store for viewers. Whatever can be said for this plot, it is not stale and leads horror into a more intelligent direction (the oposite of what the simple reading of the plot would suggest).
summary: Surprisingly more complex than you'd think
Title: The Ring

reviewText: We watched this with our teenagers for the first time.  It is impossible to believe they are in High School now and old enough to handle these movies.  :(Anyway, it is a great thriller/horror flick.
summary: This one is a great horror flick
Title: The Ring

reviewText: I purchased this by mistake, not realizing it was the Horror genre. The story centers around a video, anyone who sees it is doomed to die shortly.What a fine actress like Naomi Watts is doing in this movie is a mystery.  But, even her presence cannot save this silly story.
Title: The Ring

reviewText: When this movie came out I really didn't put much stock into it, the Blair Witch was a disaster and I was really NOT looking for anything more than maybe mediocre, at Best,- I've always loved Horror . I dont' think I've seen a decent Horror film in years, the Genre got all convoluted and laughable. This one however reminded me of the Shining - all Goosebumps ( which is what Horror should be), leaving you guessing at just what the heck is going on.It never got the recognition it deserved as far as I am concerned,and No- it didn't have big actors, writers or directors that I know of (Not when it came out , at least).But trust me - it's a Gem.What's more is it looks like they didn't spend a ton of money on a top notch film.Hat's off to everyone involved in the making of the Ring.By the way , I saw the original ringu, too and all I can say is :I am glad someone saw the potential this movie really had and made it into something memorable!Thank you!
Title: The Ring

reviewText: Very suspenseful and kept me on the edge of my seat. I enjoyed the storyline, which a lot of them are the same. So bravo for being somewhat different!
Title: The Ring

reviewText: Spooky, eerie, scary, well-executed film. Everything you want in a horror flick. But the solution seems simple enough: everybody who watches the tape makes a copy and shows it to someone else.
summary: A treat for horror buffs (contains spoiler)
Title: The Ring

reviewText: A cerebral classic right up there with The Exorcist! Most of the terror is created in your mind rather than relying on a preponderance of gore. I have found that folks with poor imaginations don't get nearly as much out of this movie as those who are creatively and empathetically....."advanced" (?)
summary: One of the Best Horror Movies made
Title: The Ring

reviewText: I liked this movie all the way to the end, as I love the mystery aspect, but I think they could have tied the story better as to where she actually came from. ?? The mother was infertile, new fertility studies??? I just think the writers dropped the ball alittle on this one.
Title: The Ring

reviewerName: Wilmar Luna "Author of The Silver Ninja"
reviewText: This was actually, a decent, scary movie. I could have sworn I wrote a review for this already but, whatever.So, I'll keep this short and sweet because as time passes I'm forgetting what I saw.There's actually a very interesting lore and backstory to this movie that's really executed well in other movies. It gives you just enough clues to keep you wanting more information. The (ring) video is appropriately creepy and when it's revealed as to what the video was actually a bit, it all makes sense in a disturbing and sad way.The movie has it's uncomfortable moments, it has its creepy moments, and overall just maintains a consistent atmosphere of dread. You might not s*** your pants in terror, but you'll definitely feel a little bit of anxiety and creepiness while watching this movie.
summary: If you never saw this movie and are curious, give it a watch.
Title: The Ring
